The good man a publick good, 1. passively, 2. actively. As it was manifested in a sermon preached to the Honourable House of Commons, at the late solemne fast: January 31. 1643. By Daniel Cavvdrey, minister of the Gospell at Great Billing in Northhamptonshire, and one of the Assembly of Divines. Cawdrey, Daniel, 1588-1664. England and Wales. Parliament. House of Commons.
[4], 43, [1] p.
Printed by Tho. Harper, for Charles Greene, and P.W., London : 1643 [i.e. 1644]
The words "1. passively, 2. actively." are bracketed together on title page. Annotation on Thomason copy: :Feb. 23th:". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
